CA1050.fullDescription: Типы объявляются в пространствах имен во избежание конфликтов имен, а также для упорядочивания связанных типов в иерархии объектов.

CA1850.fullDescription: Вместо создания экземпляра HashAlgorithm и управления этим экземпляром для вызова метода "ComputeHash" более эффективно использовать статический метод "HashData".

CS8618.shortDescription: Поле, не допускающее значения NULL, должно содержать значение, отличное от NULL, при выходе из конструктора. Рассмотрите возможность добавления модификатора "required" или объявления значения, допускающего значение NULL.

S1104.shortDescription: Fields should not have public accessibility
S1104.fullDescription: Public fields in public classes do not respect the encapsulation principle and have three main disadvantages:

S1125.shortDescription: Boolean literals should not be redundant
S1125.fullDescription: A boolean literal can be represented in two different ways: true or false. They can be combined with logical operators (!, &&, ||, ==, !=) to produce logical expressions that represent truth values. However, comparing a boolean literal to a variable or expression that evaluates to a boolean value is unnecessary and can make the code harder to read and understand. The more complex a boolean expression is, the harder it will be for developers to understand its meaning and expected behavior, and it will favour the introduction of new bugs.

S125.shortDescription: Sections of code should not be commented out
S125.fullDescription: Commented-out code distracts the focus from the actual executed code. It creates a noise that increases maintenance code. And because it is never executed, it quickly becomes out of date and invalid.

S2368.shortDescription: Public methods should not have multidimensional array parameters
S2368.fullDescription: Using multidimensional and jagged arrays as method parameters in C# can be challenging for developers.

S3776.shortDescription: Cognitive Complexity of methods should not be too high
S3776.fullDescription: This rule raises an issue when the code cognitive complexity of a function is above a certain threshold.

S3903.shortDescription: Types should be defined in named namespaces
S3903.fullDescription: Types are declared in namespaces in order to prevent name collisions and as a way to organize them into the object hierarchy. Types that are defined outside any named namespace are in a global namespace that cannot be referenced in code.

S4790.shortDescription: Using weak hashing algorithms is security-sensitive
S4790.fullDescription: Cryptographic hash algorithms such as MD2, MD4, MD5, MD6, HAVAL-128, HMAC-MD5, DSA (which uses SHA-1), RIPEMD, RIPEMD-128, RIPEMD-160, HMACRIPEMD160 and SHA-1 are no longer considered secure, because it is possible to have collisions (little computational effort is enough to find two or more different inputs that produce the same hash).
